Link Mash (March 5, 2015)

Mar 5, 2015
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • Tap for Beats Per Minute BPM. A great little tool to manually determine a song’s BPM
  • Time Sensitive Dropbox Shared Links — There’s a Workflow for That. This is a great OS X abs iOS workflow that solves a common problem.
  • The Tommy Westphall Universe. This is the most unbelievable thing I’ve ever seen.
  • Over 2,400 MS-DOS Games — Like Oregon Trail — Can Now Be Played Online. You’ve already seen this, I’m sure…but in case not, WOW.
  • Understanding the Bible 55: Conclusion – The Tree of Life… — Jesus at 2AM | A Humorous, Intelligent Introduction to the Bible, Theology, Church History & the Spiritual Life — Overcast. This is one of the greatest, most concise explanations of all of Scripture that I’ve ever heard.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.
